programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on ABC. It features a less-scripted format, highlighted by a lively round-table discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. With host Michelle Beadle.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Dallas arrives in Boston for the final leg of its road trip. The Celtics own a nine-game win streak and a sizable lead atop the Eastern Conference. Jayson Tatum's double-double trumped Luka Doncic's triple-double as Boston dumped Dallas on Jan. 22.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Bucks get acclimated to the national spotlight for this game against the Bulls. Milwaukee leads the season series 2-1, with the past two meetings requiring overtime. Chicago fell Dec. 11, 2023, despite DeMar DeRozan's 41 points and 11 assists.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Max Verstappen begins his pursuit of a fourth straight Formula One World Drivers' Championship as the 2024 campaign begins with the Bahrain Grand Prix. Verstappen won a record 19 of 22 races last season, including his first victory at this event.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 18 Gamecocks welcome the Gators to Colonial Life Arena for an SEC showdown. Florida defeated South Carolina in each of the last two seasons by a combined 29 points. The Gamecocks are 13-2 at home. The Gators are 3-5 in true road games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Wildcats host the Ducks for the final time as members of the Pac-12 Conference. Arizona moves to the Big 12 next season while Oregon joins the Big Ten. Arizona is 14-1 at home, losing to then-No. 21 Washington State 77-74 on Feb. 22.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: An in-state battle for bragging rights sees the No. 9 Tar Heels host the Wolfpack. The competition has been one-sided in recent years, with North Carolina claiming 14 of its last 17 against NC State after RJ Davis' 16 points led a 67-54 win Jan. 10.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers seek a statement win as they visit the No. 10 Blue Devils. This is the schools' first meeting since Duke defeated Virginia 59-49 in the 2023 ACC Tournament final. Commonwealth native Jeremy Roach scored 23 points for Duke in that win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Volunteers continue a gauntlet run through the SEC by visiting the No. 14 Crimson Tide. Tennessee began a run of four straight games against ranked foes by knocking off No. 11 Auburn 92-84 on Feb. 28. Dalton Knecht (TENN) scored 39 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 17 Saint Mary's hosts No. 23 Gonzaga in a regular-season finale. On Feb. 3, the Gaels beat the Bulldogs for the third time in six tries, fleeing Spokane, Wash., with a 64-62 verdict. Saint Mary's Joshua Jefferson double-doubled with four assists.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lakers host the Nuggets. Denver beat Los Angeles on banner-raising night to begin 2023-24, and again in La La Land a week before the All-Star break. Nikola Jokic (DEN) triple-doubled in the first win, but came up one assist short in the second.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: From Colonial Life Arena in Columbia, S.C.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: From Purcell Pavilion in Notre Dame, Ind.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: From Carmichael Arena in Chapel Hill, N.C.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Donovan Mitchell and the Cavaliers host the East rival Knicks for the rubber match of their season series. The visiting side won both times as the clubs split a home-and-home set earlier this campaign. Mitchell totaled 56 points in those games.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Suns and the Thunder wrap up the Arizona portion of their season series. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Jalen Williams combined to rack up 66 points in Oklahoma City's 111-99 victory at Phoenix on Nov. 12, 2023. Kevin Durant (PHX) netted 28.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors complete a four-game East Coast trek by visiting the Celtics in a 2022 Finals rematch. Stephen Curry tied the Dec. 19, 2023, meeting with a customary long 3-pointer, and Golden State went on to defeat Boston 132-126 in overtime.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Ramblers (20-8, 12-3 A-10) try to regain their lead over the No. 21 Flyers (22-5, 12-3). Dayton dumped Davidson 80-66 to avoid consecutive losses Feb. 27. Loyola Chicago fell to St. Bonaventure the same night, breaking up a seven-game win streak.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston visits unique locations and shares his fishing knowledge.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Scott and his family go out for a day on the ocean for a family fun fishing trip.

programme.title: Coach K & Roy Williams: Rivals Reunited
programme.desc: Two of the most successful NCAA basketball coaches in history, Mike Krzyzewski and Roy Williams, meet for a rare in-depth conversation, something they never did together during their coaching careers at Duke and North Carolina.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Seminoles try to increase their NCAA Tournament dreams in an ACC road engagement against the Yellow Jackets. The Seminoles have won two of their last three games. Florida State used a balanced attack to beat Georgia Tech 82-71 in January.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Longhorns try to find a better rhythm when they host the Cowboys. Texas has gone win-for-loss across its last eight outings, but has won four in a row over Oklahoma State after taking a 61-47 decision in a Big 12 Tournament quarterfinal in 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Revenge is on the agenda for the No. 11 Tigers as they host the Bulldogs. Mississippi State ended a five-game series skid by upsetting then-No. 8 Auburn 64-58 on Jan. 27. The Bulldogs' own five-game win streak was snapped Feb. 27 by No. 16 Kentucky.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Red Raiders (19-9, 8-7) resume pursuit of a double bye in the Big 12 Tournament by visiting the Mountaineers (9-19, 4-11). West Virginia won the last meeting, 78-62 in the 2023 Big 12 Tournament. Texas Tech has dropped four straight road games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Cougars (25-3, 12-3) bring a six-game win streak into their first Big 12 battle with the Sooners (19-8, 7-7). L.J. Cryer leads Houston at 15.3 points per game after scoring 22 in a 67-59 victory over Cincinnati. Oklahoma is 13-3 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Anteaters host the Beach with eyes on a second consecutive Big West regular-season title. Dylan Thoerner, who hails from Irvine, Calif., led a balanced effort with 13 points off the bench as UC Irvine took down Long Beach State 72-61 on Jan. 25.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.desc: The story of skateboarder Ryan Sheckler - a prodigy, MTV star, X Games gold medalist and hard-partier - as told in his own words.

programme.desc: The U.S. women's Olympic basketball team goes on a 52-game barnstorming tour across four continents, to train for the 1996 Games and also promote the popularity of women's basketball ahead of the launch of the WNBA after the Olympics.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mavericks put a four-game home win streak on the line as the 76ers visit Big D. Dallas defeated Philadelphia 118-102 on Feb. 5 behind Kyrie Irving's 23 points and eight assists. The Mavs are 18-13 at home, while the Sixers are 15-12 on the road.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: First Draft
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. joins Field Yates to break down the top prospects in the coming NFL draft.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: From Las Vegas Motor Speedway in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NCTS
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series runs the Victoria's Voice Foundation 200 at Las Vegas. Despite only finishing as high as seventh in his first two races, Tyler Ankrum led the most laps in Atlanta, and holds the overall lead in the points standings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Falcons begin their final road trip of the regular season when they visit the No. 22 Aggies. Air Force sprung a 78-77 upset on New Mexico at the Pit on Feb. 24 with Rytis Petraitis' late 3-pointer sealing the victory. Utah State is 12-1 at home.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Hundreds of players are competing in the PCA Main Event for a share of the $8.6m prize pool. US pros Maria Ho and Taylor Paur face off on the main stage, while reigning champ Chino Rheem continues to captivate and crush.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick
programme.desc: The film chronicles legendary NASCAR champion and FOX Sports' newest NASCAR analyst Kevin Harvick, through his exhilarating racing career and beyond the finish line to unveil the story behind the iconic athlete.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Presents
programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: From Las Vegas Motor Speedway in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series runs the Victoria's Voice Foundation 200 at Las Vegas. Despite only finishing as high as seventh in his first two races, Tyler Ankrum led the most laps in Atlanta, and holds the overall lead in the points standings.

programme.title: Bassmaster Fishing Elite Series
programme.desc: Competition from the highest level of professional bass fishing tournaments.

programme.title: FOX College Hoops Tip-Off
programme.desc: Highlights, analysis, and preview of the day's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulldogs visit the Blue Demons. Butler earned an eighth straight victory over DePaul on Jan. 20, 74-60 at home. Pierre Brooks II netted a game-high 20 points for Butler, while Posh Alexander chipped in 17 to go with six assists and six steals.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: From Las Vegas Motor Speedway in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NXS
programme.desc: Prerace with up-to-the-minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Xfinity Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: Austin Hill defends multiple crowns at The LiUNA! in NASCAR Xfinity Series action. Hill made it two straight victories to begin the new year last week in Atlanta. Last season, the 29-year-old earned the second of his four 2023 victories in this race.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Musketeers seek their fifth straight victory over the Hoyas in a Big East game. Xavier rallied past Georgetown 92-91 in January behind senior guard Quincy Olivari's 27 points and six rebounds. Georgetown has dropped six in a row at home.

programme.title: NRL Rugby
programme.desc: From Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas.

programme.title: NRL Rugby
programme.desc: From Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami CF host Orlando City SC in El Clásico del Sol. Messi scored twice in his first Florida Derby as Inter Miami won 3-1 in a Leagues Cup match Aug. 2, 2023. The Argentine great scored 26 goals in El Clásico for FC Barcelona.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Zach Edey continues a historic run when his No. 2 Boilermakers host the Spartans. Edey is second nationally with 23.7 points per game, and can become the first back-to-back AP Player of the Year and Wooden Award winner since Ralph Sampson in 1983.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Bluejays play their home finale against the No. 5 Golden Eagles in a key Big East tilt. Marquette overcame a 23-point effort from Baylor Scheierman to secure a 72-67 win over Creighton on Dec. 30, 2023, its third straight in the series.

programme.title: Bassmaster: the Cast
programme.desc: As an early Star on the B.A.S.S tournament circuit, Bill Dance becomes one of the biggest celebrities in the fishing industry.

programme.title: Bassmaster Fishing Elite Series
programme.desc: Competition from the highest level of professional bass fishing tournaments.

programme.title: Arena Motocross Nationals
programme.desc: From Hale Center in Kansas City, Mo.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: From Mid County Lanes & Entertainment in Middletown, Del.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Cup Series race.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 23 Bluejays (23-4, 14-3 Big East) roll into their season finale against the Pirates (16-12, 8-9). Creighton has won 13 of its last 14, including a 57-49 decision over Seton Hall on Jan. 28. The Pirates seek a fifth straight home victory.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons (12-18, 4-13 Big East) end their regular season by playing the Wildcats (17-11, 10-7). DePaul has lost five in a row. Lucy Olsen led Villanova with 24 points, nine assists and six rebounds in a 95-64 win over DePaul on Jan. 28.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Boilermakers (12-16, 5-12 Big Ten) and Wolverines (17-12, 8-9) end their regular seasons. Michigan is just 1-3 in its last four home games, while Purdue has won two straight on the road. Caitlyn Harper (PUR) averaged 18 points in those victories.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: KJ Simpson and the Buffaloes surge into their Pac-12 engagement with the Cardinal. Colorado has won three straight following an 88-78 decision over California. Simpson is averaging 28.3 points, 6.7 rebounds and 5.3 assists during the streak.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Caitlin Clark and the No. 6 Hawkeyes visit the No. 2 Buckeyes for a Big Ten regular-season finale. Clark, who declared for the 2024 WNBA draft on Feb. 29, is 18 points shy of passing Pete Maravich as the NCAA's all-time leading scorer.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Interviews with coaches, behind the scenes access and features on current and past Big East greats.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Presents
programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: Austin Hill defends multiple crowns at The LiUNA! in NASCAR Xfinity Series action. Hill made it two straight victories to begin the new year last week in Atlanta. Last season, the 29-year-old earned the second of his four 2023 victories in this race.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The Pennzoil 400 gets underway from Las Vegas. Last week, Daniel Suárez came out on top in the third-closest finish in Cup Series history for his first victory since June 2022. William Byron, who won the Daytona 500 on Feb. 19, won this race in 2023.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd With Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Opinions and predictions for happenings in the NFL.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Jazz seek a rare season sweep of the Heat when they share the floor in South Beach. Utah's 117-109 verdict over Miami on Dec. 30, 2023, snapped a five-game drought in the series. Utah's Keyonte George chipped in with 21 points from off the bench.

programme.title: Everything But the Chip: The 2001 76ers
programme.desc: This retrospective takes an in-depth look at one of the most eventful and rewarding seasons in 76ers history. The talented team made it all the way to the NBA Finals, led by 2001 MVP Allen Iverson and 2001 NBA Coach of the Year Larry Brown.

programme.title: Basketball Stories: Indiana Glory

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: George The Iceman Gervin is a pro and college Hall of Famer who was once the most dominant scorer in the NBA. His accolades include four NBA scoring titles, nine All-Star appearances and being honored as one of the top 50 NBA players of all time.

programme.title: Baloncesto NBA
programme.desc: Dallas llega a Boston para la última etapa de su gira. Los Celtics tienen una racha de nueve victorias consecutivas y una ventaja considerable en la cima de la Conferencia Este. Boston venció a Dallas por 119-110 el 22 de enero.

programme.desc: Los Bucks se aclimatan a los focos nacionales para este partido contra los Bulls. Milwaukee lidera la serie de la temporada 2-1, con los dos últimos enfrentamientos requiriendo tiempo extra. Chicago cayó el 11 de diciembre de 2023.
